SetColumnOffset.descriptionPlain: set position of column line (in pixels, from the left side of the contents region). pass -1 to use current column

IsItemDeactivatedAfterEdit.descriptionPlain: was the last item just made inactive and made a value change when it was active? (e.g. Slider/Drag moved). Useful for Undo/Redo patterns with widgets that requires continuous editing. Note that you may get false positives (some widgets such as Combo()/ListBox()/Selectable() will return true even when clicking an already selected item).

GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing.descriptionPlain: horizontal distance preceding label when using TreeNode*() or Bullet() == (g.FontSize + style.FramePadding.x*2) for a regular unframed TreeNode

EndDragDropSource.descriptionPlain: only call EndDragDropSource() if BeginDragDropSource() returns true!

TableGetColumnCount.descriptionPlain: return number of columns (value passed to BeginTable)

GetMousePos.descriptionPlain: shortcut to ImGui::GetIO().MousePos provided by user, to be consistent with other calls

GetForegroundDrawList.descriptionPlain: get foreground draw list for the viewport associated to the current window. this draw list will be the last rendered one. Useful to quickly draw shapes/text over dear imgui contents.

TableGetColumnName.descriptionPlain: return "" if column didn't have a name declared by TableSetupColumn(). Pass -1 to use current column.

PushStyleVar.descriptionPlain: modify a style ImVec2 variable. always use this if you modify the style after NewFrame().

TableSetColumnIndex.descriptionPlain: append into the specified column. Return true when column is visible.

ShowStyleEditor.descriptionPlain: add style editor block (not a window). you can pass in a reference ImGuiStyle structure to compare to, revert to and save to (else it uses the default style)

GetCursorPosX.descriptionPlain: (some functions are using window-relative coordinates, such as: GetCursorPos, GetCursorStartPos, GetContentRegionMax, GetWindowContentRegion* etc.

EndChildFrame.descriptionPlain: always call EndChildFrame() regardless of BeginChildFrame() return values (which indicates a collapsed/clipped window)

SetScrollHereY.descriptionPlain: adjust scrolling amount to make current cursor position visible. center_y_ratio=0.0: top, 0.5: center, 1.0: bottom. When using to make a "default/current item" visible, consider using SetItemDefaultFocus() instead.

ShowMetricsWindow.descriptionPlain: create Metrics/Debugger window. display Dear ImGui internals: windows, draw commands, various internal state, etc.

GetMouseDragDelta.descriptionPlain: return the delta from the initial clicking position while the mouse button is pressed or was just released. This is locked and return 0.0f until the mouse moves past a distance threshold at least once (if lock_threshold < -1.0f, uses io.MouseDraggingThreshold)

GetFontSize.descriptionPlain: get current font size (= height in pixels) of current font with current scale applied

UpdatePlatformWindows.descriptionPlain: call in main loop. will call CreateWindow/ResizeWindow/etc. platform functions for each secondary viewport, and DestroyWindow for each inactive viewport.

IsWindowHovered.descriptionPlain: is current window hovered (and typically: not blocked by a popup/modal)? see flags for options. NB: If you are trying to check whether your mouse should be dispatched to imgui or to your app, you should use the 'io.WantCaptureMouse' boolean for that! Please read the FAQ!

IsRectVisible.descriptionPlain: test if rectangle (in screen space) is visible / not clipped. to perform coarse clipping on user's side.

GetKeyIndex.descriptionPlain: map ImGuiKey_* values into user's key index. == io.KeyMap[key]

RadioButton.descriptionPlain: shortcut to handle the above pattern when value is an integer

BeginTabItem.descriptionPlain: create a Tab. Returns true if the Tab is selected.

IsItemEdited.descriptionPlain: did the last item modify its underlying value this frame? or was pressed? This is generally the same as the "bool" return value of many widgets.

GetVersion.descriptionPlain: get the compiled version string e.g. "1.80 WIP" (essentially the value for IMGUI_VERSION from the compiled version of imgui.cpp)

EndMenuBar.descriptionPlain: only call EndMenuBar() if BeginMenuBar() returns true!

ShowAboutWindow.descriptionPlain: create About window. display Dear ImGui version, credits and build/system information.

SetNextWindowPos.descriptionPlain: set next window position. call before Begin(). use pivot=(0.5f,0.5f) to center on given point, etc.

SetNextWindowFocus.descriptionPlain: set next window to be focused / top-most. call before Begin()

GetWindowPos.descriptionPlain: get current window position in screen space (useful if you want to do your own drawing via the DrawList API)

BeginMenuBar.descriptionPlain: append to menu-bar of current window (requires ImGuiWindowFlags_MenuBar flag set on parent window).

CollapsingHeader.descriptionPlain: when 'p_visible != NULL': if '*p_visible==true' display an additional small close button on upper right of the header which will set the bool to false when clicked, if '*p_visible==false' don't display the header.

GetWindowHeight.descriptionPlain: get current window height (shortcut for GetWindowSize().y)

IsMouseHoveringRect.descriptionPlain: is mouse hovering given bounding rect (in screen space). clipped by current clipping settings, but disregarding of other consideration of focus/window ordering/popup-block.

SetNextWindowSize.descriptionPlain: set next window size. set axis to 0.0f to force an auto-fit on this axis. call before Begin()

AlignTextToFramePadding.descriptionPlain: vertically align upcoming text baseline to FramePadding.y so that it will align properly to regularly framed items (call if you have text on a line before a framed item)

CloseCurrentPopup.descriptionPlain: manually close the popup we have begin-ed into.

SetColumnWidth.descriptionPlain: set column width (in pixels). pass -1 to use current column

GetWindowContentRegionMin.descriptionPlain: content boundaries min (roughly (0,0)-Scroll), in window coordinates

IsItemActivated.descriptionPlain: was the last item just made active (item was previously inactive).

Unindent.descriptionPlain: move content position back to the left, by indent_w, or style.IndentSpacing if indent_w <= 0

Combo.descriptionPlain: Separate items with \0 within a string, end item-list with \0\0. e.g. "One\0Two\0Three\0"

ImageButton.descriptionPlain: <0 frame_padding uses default frame padding settings. 0 for no padding

SetWindowFontScale.descriptionPlain: set font scale. Adjust IO.FontGlobalScale if you want to scale all windows. This is an old API! For correct scaling, prefer to reload font + rebuild ImFontAtlas + call style.ScaleAllSizes().

SetNextWindowBgAlpha.descriptionPlain: set next window background color alpha. helper to easily override the Alpha component of ImGuiCol_WindowBg/ChildBg/PopupBg. you may also use ImGuiWindowFlags_NoBackground.

SetWindowFocus.descriptionPlain: set named window to be focused / top-most. use NULL to remove focus.

IsMouseReleased.descriptionPlain: did mouse button released? (went from Down to !Down)

NewLine.descriptionPlain: undo a SameLine() or force a new line when in an horizontal-layout context.

SetWindowSize.descriptionPlain: set named window size. set axis to 0.0f to force an auto-fit on this axis.

SetCursorScreenPos.descriptionPlain: cursor position in absolute screen coordinates (0..io.DisplaySize) or natural OS coordinates when using multiple viewport.

ShowDemoWindow.descriptionPlain: create Demo window. demonstrate most ImGui features. call this to learn about the library! try to make it always available in your application!

GetWindowDrawList.descriptionPlain: get draw list associated to the current window, to append your own drawing primitives

SetScrollFromPosY.descriptionPlain: adjust scrolling amount to make given position visible. Generally GetCursorStartPos() + offset to compute a valid position.

GetWindowDpiScale.descriptionPlain: get DPI scale currently associated to the current window's viewport.

IsPopupOpen.descriptionPlain: return true if the popup is open.

SaveIniSettingsToDisk.descriptionPlain: this is automatically called (if io.IniFilename is not empty) a few seconds after any modification that should be reflected in the .ini file (and also by DestroyContext).

TreeNode.descriptionPlain: helper variation to easily decorelate the id from the displayed string. Read the FAQ about why and how to use ID. to align arbitrary text at the same level as a TreeNode() you can use Bullet().

MenuItem.descriptionPlain: return true when activated + toggle (*p_selected) if p_selected != NULL

LogButtons.descriptionPlain: helper to display buttons for logging to tty/file/clipboard

SetColorEditOptions.descriptionPlain: initialize current options (generally on application startup) if you want to select a default format, picker type, etc. User will be able to change many settings, unless you pass the _NoOptions flag to your calls.

GetMouseCursor.descriptionPlain: get desired cursor type, reset in ImGui::NewFrame(), this is updated during the frame. valid before Render(). If you use software rendering by setting io.MouseDrawCursor ImGui will render those for you

Separator.descriptionPlain: separator, generally horizontal. inside a menu bar or in horizontal layout mode, this becomes a vertical separator.

OpenPopup.descriptionPlain: call to mark popup as open (don't call every frame!).

Dummy.descriptionPlain: add a dummy item of given size. unlike InvisibleButton(), Dummy() won't take the mouse click or be navigable into.

GetCursorPos.descriptionPlain: cursor position in window coordinates (relative to window position)

InvisibleButton.descriptionPlain: flexible button behavior without the visuals, frequently useful to build custom behaviors using the public api (along with IsItemActive, IsItemHovered, etc.)

EndDragDropTarget.descriptionPlain: only call EndDragDropTarget() if BeginDragDropTarget() returns true!

BeginDragDropTarget.descriptionPlain: call after submitting an item that may receive a payload. If this returns true, you can call AcceptDragDropPayload() + EndDragDropTarget()

TableSetupScrollFreeze.descriptionPlain: lock columns/rows so they stay visible when scrolled.

IsMouseDoubleClicked.descriptionPlain: did mouse button double-clicked? (note that a double-click will also report IsMouseClicked() == true)

GetWindowWidth.descriptionPlain: get current window width (shortcut for GetWindowSize().x)

TextWrapped.descriptionPlain: shortcut for PushTextWrapPos(0.0f); Text(fmt, ...); PopTextWrapPos();. Note that this won't work on an auto-resizing window if there's no other widgets to extend the window width, yoy may need to set a size using SetNextWindowSize().

GetStyleColorName.descriptionPlain: get a string corresponding to the enum value (for display, saving, etc.).

SmallButton.descriptionPlain: button with FramePadding=(0,0) to easily embed within text

IsMouseClicked.descriptionPlain: did mouse button clicked? (went from !Down to Down)

BeginPopupContextWindow.descriptionPlain: open+begin popup when clicked on current window.

ShowFontSelector.descriptionPlain: add font selector block (not a window), essentially a combo listing the loaded fonts.

SetScrollHereX.descriptionPlain: adjust scrolling amount to make current cursor position visible. center_x_ratio=0.0: left, 0.5: center, 1.0: right. When using to make a "default/current item" visible, consider using SetItemDefaultFocus() instead.

PushAllowKeyboardFocus.descriptionPlain: allow focusing using TAB/Shift-TAB, enabled by default but you can disable it for certain widgets

IsKeyReleased.descriptionPlain: was key released (went from Down to !Down)?

IsMouseDragging.descriptionPlain: is mouse dragging? (if lock_threshold < -1.0f, uses io.MouseDraggingThreshold)

SameLine.descriptionPlain: call between widgets or groups to layout them horizontally. X position given in window coordinates.

BeginMenu.descriptionPlain: create a sub-menu entry. only call EndMenu() if this returns true!

ShowUserGuide.descriptionPlain: add basic help/info block (not a window): how to manipulate ImGui as a end-user (mouse/keyboard controls).

SetTooltip.descriptionPlain: set a text-only tooltip, typically use with ImGui::IsItemHovered(). override any previous call to SetTooltip().

SetKeyboardFocusHere.descriptionPlain: focus keyboard on the next widget. Use positive 'offset' to access sub components of a multiple component widget. Use -1 to access previous widget.

IsItemHovered.descriptionPlain: is the last item hovered? (and usable, aka not blocked by a popup, etc.). See ImGuiHoveredFlags for more options.

GetTextLineHeightWithSpacing.descriptionPlain: ~ FontSize + style.ItemSpacing.y (distance in pixels between 2 consecutive lines of text)

GetKeyPressedAmount.descriptionPlain: uses provided repeat rate/delay. return a count, most often 0 or 1 but might be >1 if RepeatRate is small enough that DeltaTime > RepeatRate

SetTabItemClosed.descriptionPlain: notify TabBar or Docking system of a closed tab/window ahead (useful to reduce visual flicker on reorderable tab bars). For tab-bar: call after BeginTabBar() and before Tab submissions. Otherwise call with a window name.

GetStyle.descriptionPlain: access the Style structure (colors, sizes). Always use PushStyleCol(), PushStyleVar() to modify style mid-frame!

ListBoxFooter.descriptionPlain: terminate the scrolling region. only call ListBoxFooter() if ListBoxHeader() returned true!

BeginMainMenuBar.descriptionPlain: create and append to a full screen menu-bar.

IsMousePosValid.descriptionPlain: by convention we use (-FLT_MAX,-FLT_MAX) to denote that there is no mouse available

IsWindowDocked.descriptionPlain: is current window docked into another window?

GetFrameHeightWithSpacing.descriptionPlain: ~ FontSize + style.FramePadding.y * 2 + style.ItemSpacing.y (distance in pixels between 2 consecutive lines of framed widgets)

NextColumn.descriptionPlain: next column, defaults to current row or next row if the current row is finished

EndFrame.descriptionPlain: ends the Dear ImGui frame. automatically called by Render(). If you don't need to render data (skipping rendering) you may call EndFrame() without Render()... but you'll have wasted CPU already! If you don't need to render, better to not create any windows and not call NewFrame() at all!

PushItemWidth.descriptionPlain: push width of items for common large "item+label" widgets. >0.0f: width in pixels, <0.0f align xx pixels to the right of window (so -FLT_MIN always align width to the right side).

EndCombo.descriptionPlain: only call EndCombo() if BeginCombo() returns true!

TreePush.descriptionPlain: ~ Indent()+PushId(). Already called by TreeNode() when returning true, but you can call TreePush/TreePop yourself if desired.

TabItemButton.descriptionPlain: create a Tab behaving like a button. return true when clicked. cannot be selected in the tab bar.

TextUnformatted.descriptionPlain: raw text without formatting. Roughly equivalent to Text("%s", text) but: A) doesn't require null terminated string if 'text_end' is specified, B) it's faster, no memory copy is done, no buffer size limits, recommended for long chunks of text.

CaptureKeyboardFromApp.descriptionPlain: attention: misleading name! manually override io.WantCaptureKeyboard flag next frame (said flag is entirely left for your application to handle). e.g. force capture keyboard when your widget is being hovered. This is equivalent to setting "io.WantCaptureKeyboard = want_capture_keyboard_value"; after the next NewFrame() call.

TextDisabled.descriptionPlain: shortcut for PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, style.Colors[ImGuiCol_TextDisabled]); Text(fmt, ...); PopStyleColor();

TextColored.descriptionPlain: shortcut for PushStyleColor(ImGuiCol_Text, col); Text(fmt, ...); PopStyleColor();

BeginDragDropSource.descriptionPlain: call when the current item is active. If this return true, you can call SetDragDropPayload() + EndDragDropSource()

GetCursorPosY.descriptionPlain: other functions such as GetCursorScreenPos or everything in ImDrawList::

GetContentRegionMax.descriptionPlain: current content boundaries (typically window boundaries including scrolling, or current column boundaries), in windows coordinates

TableSetBgColor.descriptionPlain: change the color of a cell, row, or column. See ImGuiTableBgTarget_ flags for details.

EndMenu.descriptionPlain: only call EndMenu() if BeginMenu() returns true!

TableNextRow.descriptionPlain: append into the first cell of a new row.

TableNextColumn.descriptionPlain: append into the next column (or first column of next row if currently in last column). Return true when column is visible.

TableHeadersRow.descriptionPlain: submit all headers cells based on data provided to TableSetupColumn() + submit context menu

TableHeader.descriptionPlain: submit one header cell manually (rarely used)

IsItemFocused.descriptionPlain: is the last item focused for keyboard/gamepad navigation?

SetNextWindowContentSize.descriptionPlain: set next window content size (~ scrollable client area, which enforce the range of scrollbars). Not including window decorations (title bar, menu bar, etc.) nor WindowPadding. set an axis to 0.0f to leave it automatic. call before Begin()

SetScrollFromPosX.descriptionPlain: adjust scrolling amount to make given position visible. Generally GetCursorStartPos() + offset to compute a valid position.

StyleColorsLight.descriptionPlain: best used with borders and a custom, thicker font

ShowStyleSelector.descriptionPlain: add style selector block (not a window), essentially a combo listing the default styles.

IsKeyPressed.descriptionPlain: was key pressed (went from !Down to Down)? if repeat=true, uses io.KeyRepeatDelay / KeyRepeatRate

SetItemDefaultFocus.descriptionPlain: make last item the default focused item of a window.

SliderFloat.descriptionPlain: adjust format to decorate the value with a prefix or a suffix for in-slider labels or unit display.

GetScrollMaxX.descriptionPlain: get maximum scrolling amount ~~ ContentSize.x - WindowSize.x - DecorationsSize.x

EndTable.descriptionPlain: only call EndTable() if BeginTable() returns true!

BeginChildFrame.descriptionPlain: helper to create a child window / scrolling region that looks like a normal widget frame

IsItemActive.descriptionPlain: is the last item active? (e.g. button being held, text field being edited. This will continuously return true while holding mouse button on an item. Items that don't interact will always return false)

EndTabBar.descriptionPlain: only call EndTabBar() if BeginTabBar() returns true!

GetCursorScreenPos.descriptionPlain: cursor position in absolute screen coordinates (0..io.DisplaySize) or natural OS coordinates when using multiple viewport. Useful to work with ImDrawList API.

GetColumnOffset.descriptionPlain: get position of column line (in pixels, from the left side of the contents region). pass -1 to use current column, otherwise 0..GetColumnsCount() inclusive. column 0 is typically 0.0f

PushButtonRepeat.descriptionPlain: in 'repeat' mode, Button*() functions return repeated true in a typematic manner (using io.KeyRepeatDelay/io.KeyRepeatRate setting). Note that you can call IsItemActive() after any Button() to tell if the button is held in the current frame.

Indent.descriptionPlain: move content position toward the right, by indent_w, or style.IndentSpacing if indent_w <= 0

CalcItemWidth.descriptionPlain: width of item given pushed settings and current cursor position. NOT necessarily the width of last item unlike most 'Item' functions.

BeginPopupModal.descriptionPlain: return true if the modal is open, and you can start outputting to it.

OpenPopupOnItemClick.descriptionPlain: helper to open popup when clicked on last item. return true when just opened. (note: actually triggers on the mouse _released_ event to be consistent with popup behaviors)

CaptureMouseFromApp.descriptionPlain: attention: misleading name! manually override io.WantCaptureMouse flag next frame (said flag is entirely left for your application to handle). This is equivalent to setting "io.WantCaptureMouse = want_capture_mouse_value;" after the next NewFrame() call.

DestroyPlatformWindows.descriptionPlain: call DestroyWindow platform functions for all viewports. call from backend Shutdown() if you need to close platform windows before imgui shutdown. otherwise will be called by DestroyContext().

IsWindowFocused.descriptionPlain: is current window focused? or its root/child, depending on flags. see flags for options.

GetTime.descriptionPlain: get global imgui time. incremented by io.DeltaTime every frame.

IsItemClicked.descriptionPlain: is the last item clicked? (e.g. button/node just clicked on) == IsMouseClicked(mouse_button) && IsItemHovered()

DragFloat.descriptionPlain: If v_min >= v_max we have no bound

IsItemVisible.descriptionPlain: is the last item visible? (items may be out of sight because of clipping/scrolling)

GetFrameCount.descriptionPlain: get global imgui frame count. incremented by 1 every frame.

Bullet.descriptionPlain: draw a small circle + keep the cursor on the same line. advance cursor x position by GetTreeNodeToLabelSpacing(), same distance that TreeNode() uses

PushID.descriptionPlain: push integer into the ID stack (will hash integer).

ListBoxHeaderXY.descriptionPlain: use if you want to reimplement ListBox() will custom data or interactions. if the function return true, you can output elements then call ListBoxFooter() afterwards.

BeginPopup.descriptionPlain: return true if the popup is open, and you can start outputting to it.

EndMainMenuBar.descriptionPlain: only call EndMainMenuBar() if BeginMainMenuBar() returns true!

ArrowButton.descriptionPlain: square button with an arrow shape

EndGroup.descriptionPlain: unlock horizontal starting position + capture the whole group bounding box into one "item" (so you can use IsItemHovered() or layout primitives such as SameLine() on whole group, etc.)

BeginPopupContextItem.descriptionPlain: open+begin popup when clicked on last item. if you can pass a NULL str_id only if the previous item had an id. If you want to use that on a non-interactive item such as Text() you need to pass in an explicit ID here. read comments in .cpp!

GetCursorStartPos.descriptionPlain: initial cursor position in window coordinates

GetFontTexUvWhitePixel.descriptionPlain: get UV coordinate for a while pixel, useful to draw custom shapes via the ImDrawList API

GetBackgroundDrawList.descriptionPlain: get background draw list for the viewport associated to the current window. this draw list will be the first rendering one. Useful to quickly draw shapes/text behind dear imgui contents.

IsItemToggledOpen.descriptionPlain: was the last item open state toggled? set by TreeNode().

ColorButton.descriptionPlain: display a color square/button, hover for details, return true when pressed.

BeginTabBar.descriptionPlain: create and append into a TabBar

Selectable.descriptionPlain: "bool* p_selected" point to the selection state (read-write), as a convenient helper.

GetItemRectMax.descriptionPlain: get lower-right bounding rectangle of the last item (screen space)

LogText.descriptionPlain: pass text data straight to log (without being displayed)

GetItemRectMin.descriptionPlain: get upper-left bounding rectangle of the last item (screen space)

GetScrollMaxY.descriptionPlain: get maximum scrolling amount ~~ ContentSize.y - WindowSize.y - DecorationsSize.y

CalcListClipping.descriptionPlain: calculate coarse clipping for large list of evenly sized items. Prefer using the ImGuiListClipper higher-level helper if you can.

GetColumnWidth.descriptionPlain: get column width (in pixels). pass -1 to use current column

BeginPopupContextVoid.descriptionPlain: open+begin popup when clicked in void (where there are no windows).

GetMousePosOnOpeningCurrentPopup.descriptionPlain: retrieve mouse position at the time of opening popup we have BeginPopup() into (helper to avoid user backing that value themselves)

DragInt.descriptionPlain: If v_min >= v_max we have no bound

IsItemDeactivated.descriptionPlain: was the last item just made inactive (item was previously active). Useful for Undo/Redo patterns with widgets that requires continuous editing.

LabelText.descriptionPlain: display text+label aligned the same way as value+label widgets

LoadIniSettingsFromDisk.descriptionPlain: call after CreateContext() and before the first call to NewFrame(). NewFrame() automatically calls LoadIniSettingsFromDisk(io.IniFilename).

EndTabItem.descriptionPlain: only call EndTabItem() if BeginTabItem() returns true!

SetCursorPos.descriptionPlain: are using the main, absolute coordinate system.

EndPopup.descriptionPlain: only call EndPopup() if BeginPopupXXX() returns true!

PushTextWrapPos.descriptionPlain: push word-wrapping position for Text*() commands. < 0.0f: no wrapping; 0.0f: wrap to end of window (or column); > 0.0f: wrap at 'wrap_pos_x' position in window local space

GetWindowContentRegionMax.descriptionPlain: content boundaries max (roughly (0,0)+Size-Scroll) where Size can be override with SetNextWindowContentSize(), in window coordinates

Render.descriptionPlain: ends the Dear ImGui frame, finalize the draw data. You can then get call GetDrawData().

GetStyleColorVec4.descriptionPlain: retrieve style color as stored in ImGuiStyle structure. use to feed back into PushStyleColor(), otherwise use GetColorU32() to get style color with style alpha baked in.

SetItemAllowOverlap.descriptionPlain: allow last item to be overlapped by a subsequent item. sometimes useful with invisible buttons, selectables, etc. to catch unused area.

BeginTooltip.descriptionPlain: begin/append a tooltip window. to create full-featured tooltip (with any kind of items).

SetNextItemWidth.descriptionPlain: set width of the _next_ common large "item+label" widget. >0.0f: width in pixels, <0.0f align xx pixels to the right of window (so -FLT_MIN always align width to the right side)

SetNextWindowCollapsed.descriptionPlain: set next window collapsed state. call before Begin()

CloneOutput.descriptionPlain: Create a clone of the CmdBuffer/IdxBuffer/VtxBuffer.

PathArcToFast.descriptionPlain: Use precomputed angles for a 12 steps circle

AddDrawCmd.descriptionPlain: This is useful if you need to forcefully create a new draw call (to allow for dependent rendering / blending). Otherwise primitives are merged into the same draw-call as much as possible

PushClipRect.descriptionPlain: Render-level scissoring. This is passed down to your render function but not used for CPU-side coarse clipping. Prefer using higher-level ImGui::PushClipRect() to affect logic (hit-testing and widget culling)

AddRect.descriptionPlain: a: upper-left, b: lower-right (== upper-left + size), rounding_corners_flags: 4 bits corresponding to which corner to round

AddRectFilled.descriptionPlain: a: upper-left, b: lower-right (== upper-left + size)

PrimRect.descriptionPlain: Axis aligned rectangle (composed of two triangles)
